title: ONCE
body_text:
This is what it has come to - perhaps the biggest, most crucial confrontation in
EastCoastDodgeball
history when arguably the four most iconic figures of all-time battle it out with incomparable stakes on the line .. and it happens just this
once
.
Kevin Adams and Kevin Megill
look to terminate the captains careers of
Chris Adams and John Tronolone
in a match nearly a
half-decade in the making
.
________________________________________
_____________________________
Favorites To Win?
With a combined 16 total captains victories, the destructive Kevin-Kevin pairing is  the paper favorite heading into "Immaculate Redemption." They have
never
lost to either of their longtime foes
(see chart below)
.
Tronolone on the other hand carries with him something no other competitor can claim:
White Flag
match experience. His captaincy had previously been tested on three separate occasions and each time, he was triumphant. This life-or-death stipulation may fuel his army's will to win.
DODGEBALL 30
..
DODGEBALL 49
..
DODGEBALL 50
..
DODGEBALL 79
..
DODGEBALL LXXXI
..
DODGEBALL 100
..
DODGEBALL C30
..
DODGEBALL 166
________________________________________
_____________________________
Career Highlights
Season Finale main events. Multiple achievement awards. Unmatched physical destruction. Hall of Fame resum'es. Quite possibly, the four greatest ever and here's why.
CHRISTOPHER D. ADAMS
Birth Date: March 10, 1982
Debut: DODGEBALL DAY 3
3x season finale headliner
(50, 70, C30)
2x mid-season main event headliner
(105, CXV)
won first
PickYourPoison
match
won first
BoxBall Dodgeball
match
2x
Rimshot Contest
winner
(first-ever)
3rd
Championship Chase
winner
2007 "Rivalry of the Year" finalist
(vs. Kevin Fitzpatrick)
2006 "King and Queen" award winner
(with Lauren Freda)
2006 "Best Dressed" award winner
2005 "Powerhouse Thrower" award winner
JOHN B. TRONOLONE
Birth Date: September 27, 1984
Debut: DODGEBALL DAY 1
4x season finale headliner
(20, 30, LX, 100)
mid-season main event headliner
(CLX5)
won the only three
White Flag
matches
6x
Battle Royal
winner
(first-ever)
Rimshot Contest
winner
2008 "Captain of the Year" finalist
2007 "Concept of the Year" award winner
2006 "High Jump" award winner
2005 "King of Dodgeball" crown
KEVIN R. ADAMS
Birth Date: February 1, 1990
Debut: DODGEBALL DAY 5
3x season finale headliner
(X, 50, 100)
mid-season main event headliner
(CXLV)
won first 2-on-2 captains match
won first
CREAMation Rules
match
won first 3-on-3 captains match
6th 2006
Captains Champion
2007 "Player of the Year" award winner
2006 "Appreciation" award winner
2005 "Act of Courage" award winner
KEVIN J. MEGILL JR.
Birth Date: August 8, 1983
Debut: DODGEBALL DAY 2
3x season finale headliner
(30, 80, C30)
mid-season main event headliner
(95)
won first
BoxBall Dodgeball
match
2007 "Rivalry of the Year" finalist
(vs. Michael Edwards)
2006 "Powerhouse Thrower" award winner
2006 "Appreciation" award winner
2006 "Best Dressed" award winner
2006 "Deflection Defense" award winner
________________________________________
_____________________________
Do or Die, Now or Never
In putting their own battle issues aside, "The Axe" and "The Creation" have this one and only opportunity to conquer the near-impossible. If they ultimately fail, both will be forced to give up their captaincy forever.
Remember, "Immaculate Redemption" emanates from the worshiped
Wall High School
battlegrounds on
August 14
beginning at
6pm
. Lights will proceed to power off a little after 9pm so be sure to arrive early to catch all the intense action.
"If a loss means losing to the best, then I'm okay with that. But still, I'd love to win, and I'm going to try damn hard to."
- CHRIS ADAMS
"I've done it all in this great game, except this. Here's my last chance at redemption."
- JOHN TRONOLONE
"Losing is not something I do often, and I'll be damned if I give it any less than my all."
- KEVIN ADAMS
"I don't care for Chris and John when they're captains. I'd enjoy ending any captain future."
- KEVIN MEGILL
Which team will be victorious at "Immaculate Redemption"?
Chris Adams and John Tronolone
Kevin Adams and Kevin Megill
A tie score perhaps?
It's too close to call.

body_html:
This is what it has come to - perhaps the biggest, most crucial confrontation in EastCoastDodgeball history when arguably the four most iconic figures of all-time battle it out with incomparable stakes on the line .. and it happens just this once. Kevin Adams and Kevin Megill look to terminate the captains careers of Chris Adams and John Tronolone in a match nearly a half-decade in the making.

_____________________________________________________________________


Favorites To Win?
With a combined 16 total captains victories, the destructive Kevin-Kevin pairing is the paper favorite heading into "Immaculate Redemption." They have never lost to either of their longtime foes (see chart below).

Tronolone on the other hand carries with him something no other competitor can claim: White Flag match experience. His captaincy had previously been tested on three separate occasions and each time, he was triumphant. This life-or-death stipulation may fuel his army's will to win.



DODGEBALL 30 .. DODGEBALL 49 .. DODGEBALL 50 .. DODGEBALL 79 .. DODGEBALL LXXXI .. DODGEBALL 100 .. DODGEBALL C30 .. DODGEBALL 166

_____________________________________________________________________


Career Highlights
Season Finale main events. Multiple achievement awards. Unmatched physical destruction. Hall of Fame resum'es. Quite possibly, the four greatest ever and here's why.

CHRISTOPHER D. ADAMS
Birth Date: March 10, 1982
Debut: DODGEBALL DAY 3
  • 3x season finale headliner (50, 70, C30)
  • 2x mid-season main event headliner (105, CXV)
  • won first PickYourPoison match
  • won first BoxBall Dodgeball match
  • 2x Rimshot Contest winner (first-ever)
  • 3rd Championship Chase winner
  • 2007 "Rivalry of the Year" finalist (vs. Kevin Fitzpatrick)
  • 2006 "King and Queen" award winner (with Lauren Freda)
  • 2006 "Best Dressed" award winner
  • 2005 "Powerhouse Thrower" award winner

    JOHN B. TRONOLONE
    Birth Date: September 27, 1984
    Debut: DODGEBALL DAY 1
  • 4x season finale headliner (20, 30, LX, 100)
  • mid-season main event headliner (CLX5)
  • won the only three White Flag matches
  • 6x Battle Royal winner (first-ever)
  • Rimshot Contest winner
  • 2008 "Captain of the Year" finalist
  • 2007 "Concept of the Year" award winner
  • 2006 "High Jump" award winner
  • 2005 "King of Dodgeball" crown

    KEVIN R. ADAMS
    Birth Date: February 1, 1990
    Debut: DODGEBALL DAY 5
  • 3x season finale headliner (X, 50, 100)
  • mid-season main event headliner (CXLV)
  • won first 2-on-2 captains match
  • won first CREAMation Rules match
  • won first 3-on-3 captains match
  • 6th 2006 Captains Champion
  • 2007 "Player of the Year" award winner
  • 2006 "Appreciation" award winner
  • 2005 "Act of Courage" award winner

    KEVIN J. MEGILL JR.
    Birth Date: August 8, 1983
    Debut: DODGEBALL DAY 2
  • 3x season finale headliner (30, 80, C30)
  • mid-season main event headliner (95)
  • won first BoxBall Dodgeball match
  • 2007 "Rivalry of the Year" finalist (vs. Michael Edwards)
  • 2006 "Powerhouse Thrower" award winner
  • 2006 "Appreciation" award winner
  • 2006 "Best Dressed" award winner
  • 2006 "Deflection Defense" award winner

    _____________________________________________________________________


    Do or Die, Now or Never
    In putting their own battle issues aside, "The Axe" and "The Creation" have this one and only opportunity to conquer the near-impossible. If they ultimately fail, both will be forced to give up their captaincy forever.

    Remember, "Immaculate Redemption" emanates from the worshiped Wall High School battlegrounds on August 14 beginning at 6pm. Lights will proceed to power off a little after 9pm so be sure to arrive early to catch all the intense action.

    "If a loss means losing to the best, then I'm okay with that. But still, I'd love to win, and I'm going to try damn hard to."
    - CHRIS ADAMS

    "I've done it all in this great game, except this. Here's my last chance at redemption."
    - JOHN TRONOLONE

    "Losing is not something I do often, and I'll be damned if I give it any less than my all."
    - KEVIN ADAMS

    "I don't care for Chris and John when they're captains. I'd enjoy ending any captain future."
    - KEVIN MEGILL


    Which team will be victorious at "Immaculate Redemption"?
    Chris Adams and John Tronolone
    Kevin Adams and Kevin Megill
    A tie score perhaps?
    It's too close to call.
      
    pollcode.com free polls
